results.title: Gisser job (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
Psychological studies of people at work. Considers ways in which stress associated with unemployment and among working people may be reduced.

results.title: Giselle
results.creator_credit: Oleg Vinogradov, Gosteleradio, National Video Corporation (International), Maxim Krastin and Preben Montell
results.brief_description: This presentation of Giselle is performed by The Kirov Ballet at the Leningrad Theatre of Opera and Ballet. A romantic ballet in two acts featuring Galina Mezentseva (Giselle), Konstantin Zaklinsky (Albrecht), Gennadi Selyutski (Hilarion), Tatyana Terekhova (Myrtha) and Olga Vtorishina and Sergei Vuharev dancing the Pas de Deux in Act one with choreography by Jean Coralli and Jules Perrot, revised by Marius Petipa, and the Orchestra of the Leningrad Theatre of Opera and Ballet conducted by Viktor Fedotov. A beautifully staged ballet in soft pastels and fairy-tale atmosphere. Made for television.

results.title: Giselle
results.creator_credit: Stanley Dorfman, Associated Television and Rudolf Nureyev
results.brief_description: This made for television production of the classical ballet Giselle about love and betrayal stars Rudolf Nureyev as Count Albrect and Lynn Seymour as Giselle, with Monica Mason (Myrtha), Youri Vamos (Hilarion) and members of The Ballet of the Bavarian State Opera House. Original choreography by Jules Perrot and Jean Coralli, music by Adolphe Adam performed by The New World Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted and directed by David Coleman.

results.title: Giselle
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Maina Gielgud and Geoffrey Nottage
results.brief_description: The story of Giselle is a romantic tale of innocent love and betrayal, of Prince Albrecht and a trusting peasant maid, Giselle. This beautiful production of this classic ballet is directed by Maina Gielgud, Artistic Director of the Australian Ballet.

results.title: Girls, girls, girls (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Hal B Wallis, Wallis-Hazen and Norman Taurog
results.brief_description: Over a dozen Hollywood leading ladies, including Stella Stevens, star with Elvis Presley in this lighthearted musical about a nightclub singer who runs a fishing boat as a hobby. Songs featured include ‘Return to Sender’, ‘I Don’t Want To’, ‘Because of Love’ and ‘Song of the Shrimp’.

results.title: Girl to woman
results.creator_credit: Robert Churchill, Churchill Films and David Hilberman
results.brief_description: Presents the changes of adolescence, from the superficial changes of growth, skin, body hair and body contour to the more complicated phenomena of glandular changes, sexual maturation, and the reproductive function. Throughout the film, individual differences such as those in rates of growth and in menstrual cycles are stressed as normal; the importance of sound habits of personal hygiene and health are highlighted. Also describes the male reproductive system. Narrated by Irene Tedrow.

results.title: Girl stuff
results.creator_credit: Robert Churchill, Churchill Films and Barbara Noble
results.brief_description: Aimed at adolescent girls this program covers a range of issues regarding female hygiene. Discusses the pros and cons of deodorants, advice about pelvic infections and changes in the reproductive system at puberty.
